website_summaries.verdict: This heavy-duty cast iron grate has a solid one-piece basket style design that helps your fire burn hot and effectively.
pros: Design helps keep the fire burning without a lot of poking or stoking
Less ash left over after burn
No danger of welds coming apart because this grate is cast iron
cons: Legs are very short, which may make it too low for fireplaces with a gas starter

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: Horrible quality! Pieces started breaking before being used. Unfortunately, I can't return because I can't find a box big enough to ship it back. Total waste of money. Will not order this type of item again that is too hard to ship back. You can see the broken pieces in the picture.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay J

customer_reviews.title: It is not 15" deep as the description states. It is only 12" deep.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 27" grate (twice). Both were only 12" deep. If you want a 27" x 12" (x 4" high) fireplace grate, this one is for you. If you want a grate that is 27" x 15", keep looking. I gave it 2 stars because I really liked the feel and heft of the grate - it was just too small and didn't match the product description. I ordered a replacement for the first one, since it was possible that they sent the wrong one. After the second was also only 12", I moved on. I hope they either fix the description, or get the right grate.
customer_reviews.author: Coton Luv

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a good buy
customer_reviews.text: After reading some of the reviews on cheaper offerings, I went with this option and I'm pretty happy I did. This appears to be a high quality, well made piece. I had a couple fires on it in early spring and it shows no signs of a problem. I'll update the review next year if it looks like that's changing.
customer_reviews.author: ZTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Very Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: We use our fireplace almost daily in the winter. This grate lasts 3 to 4 years.
customer_reviews.author: Bargain Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Quality grate!
customer_reviews.text: Replacement for old grate that had broken after many years of use. Fits perfectly in our fireplace. It's very heavy and seems very sturdy. Happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: paty9221

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: Looks "grate!" (Haha) Very pleased - arrived promptly and well-packaged. Appears exactly as represented - very solid and heavy-duty. I'm sure it will serve us well this winter.
customer_reviews.author: linda w

customer_reviews.title: The longer legs allow for better ventilation and more room for ashes to accumulate between ...
customer_reviews.text: Had purchased a log grate at a big box store and after four fires in the fire pit, it was a warped up piece of trash. I wanted a grate that could take the heat as well as allow for enough clearance for my propane log lighter underneath. The longer legs allow for better ventilation and more room for ashes to accumulate between cleanings. This grate is built like a storm drain cover in the curb. I really don't think the heat will ever destroy it. The flat floor of this grate holds an adequate number of logs and requires very little stoking. I am totally satisfied and would recommend it unconditionally.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My grandfather loved it,
customer_reviews.text: "Looks just like the one I bought over 20 years ago" ~ Grandfather likes it, threw his old broken one right out. It's already seen a few fires so I know it's not defective and waiting to crumble to death.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Rencsak

customer_reviews.title: Heavy weight model
customer_reviews.text: Much heavier weight than others. Lite weight models burn out after a season. I have only used this one one season so far but looks like new.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Vukson

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied with this product. Very sturdy and high enough off the floor to keep the hot ashs and coals from not allowing proper air flow to keep your grate from burning out . This one is made from real cast not just a medium steel that doesn't hold up. Would highly recommend this for many evenings in front of your warming fire .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Great Grate
customer_reviews.text: This heavy-duty grate works well in our fireplace, especially considering how hot we like our fires! If you want a dependable grate, this is the one.
customer_reviews.author: E Hazlett

customer_reviews.title: This GRATE is GREAT
customer_reviews.text: This fireplace grate is everything I was looking for. Heavy, strong, solid, and I can tell it was built to last. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: KBME

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased.
customer_reviews.text: Solid. well built. Should last a long time. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: This is the one!
customer_reviews.text: This was the purchase of the year. My fireplace is equipped with a gas assist starter so the leg high was needed. As posted by another customer, it is place the logs on, no playing around working the fire. The material assures me of long use before needing to replace.
customer_reviews.author: mark

customer_reviews.title: Just Right
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for our large fireplace, and the legs left plenty of room to fit good-sized ash pans underneath. Exactly what we were hoping for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No more bent rods everywhere from poor quality steel grates
customer_reviews.text: Very strong grate and makes fires much easier to maintain in my fireplace. No more bent rods everywhere from poor quality steel grates. Measure your floor and choose the correct size grate for years of easy to maintainence. Also, cast iron is the best for any fireplace.
customer_reviews.author: S. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Just what we wanted
customer_reviews.text: Its sturdy, the right size, and we have already used it a number of times. Were very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: SANJ

customer_reviews.title: High boy
customer_reviews.text: This is a good, sturdy fireplace grate. The 4 inch legs make it easier to clean out ashes and also helps with circulation of air. It came packed very well. We're pleased.
customer_reviews.author: June

customer_reviews.title: well built, needs to be a bit larger.
customer_reviews.text: Much heavier stock than the cheaper units, so I believe it will last longer. I like the added leg height. I wish it added another inch or two to the rear width - it measures only 16 inches and flared the front (currently about 19 inches) to 21 or 22 inches. Standard firewood is 16 inch length and often varies a few inches. Many logs will not fit into the "cradle" with these dimensions and the raised sides of the design make log turning very difficult, indeed, and the logs hang out over the sides. it would function much better if you could maintain 16 inch logs in the "cradle".
customer_reviews.author: K. Ludvigsen

customer_reviews.title: Great Merchandise.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic company and merchandise. Answered phone and all my questions.
customer_reviews.author: Marion E. Mapel

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The grate is the size I want and very satisfactory. Lee
customer_reviews.author: Lee Haas

customer_reviews.title: Did the job
customer_reviews.text: Great fire grate to keep logs from rolling out. Served the purpose of keeping the wood in firebox. No more comments.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Noakes

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed!  Not "Heavy-Duty!"
customer_reviews.text: Very Disappointed! I purchased this fireplace grate just over a year ago, have used it approximately one time per week since, and just found the center to be cracked and broken. I only burn wood, no chemicals or any type of accelerant which would cause a fire to burn exceedingly hot. The product description stated: "Heavy-duty cast iron construction." See the attached pictures for the product failure. I gave the product two stars because I liked the height and overall design. However, a heavy-duty cast iron grate should be much more durable and last longer than 13 months being used once a week!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Much safer than the cheap ones
customer_reviews.text: We put this in our fireplace after the cheap old bent-metal one let a large log roll right out onto our hard-wood living room floor. No problems like that with this one. Not that it couldn't happen, but the design of this one makes that much less likely. This is a safer grate. We've also noticed that we get a much more complete burn using this grate. Far less ash left over...by about half. I never expected this as an additional benefit, but I'll take it. This is an excellent design, and it's very well made.
customer_reviews.author: David Obergoenner

customer_reviews.title: Best of breed
customer_reviews.text: Everything I expected and more. Solid, heavy and durable. The last one I had lasted 17 years. I broke it when I accidentally dropped it on my concrete patio. If I get the same results from my new grate, it would be a great value at twice the price.
customer_reviews.author: paul bartolotta

customer_reviews.title: The Best Grate I've Owned
customer_reviews.text: The last several grates I've bought have warped within two years. One curved to the floor the second time I had a fire. This one has gone through many fires with no noticeable wear or warping. If it ever wears out I will buy another.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, solid, a bit small for my fireplace (my fault)
customer_reviews.text: Not quite as big as I thought I needed. Bottom is red as I think regular use has burnt the black topping off---not really a concern. Wide enough bottom screen for ashes to fall. I have a large fireplace and should have looked for a much larger grate (maybe 34" wide about 6" deep). I will say that it's nicely raised at 4" is a perfect height. I've built several fires and feel I've gotten my money's worth but I'll be looking for a larger grate in the future to replace this one.
customer_reviews.author: douffus

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Love this style of grate. Sturdy and lasted longer than I expected. Ordered same one again.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best!
customer_reviews.text: All these years I have been struggling with what turns out to be the wrong fireplace grate. Constant turning of logs and the like...but no more. This rack fits my smaller size fireplace and keeps the logs and hair embers close so the fire burns hot and oh so completely. Just keep adding logs. No more every 10 minutes of turning and playing around. This rack is so good that this is my second one...I have two fireplaces.
customer_reviews.author: Richard M. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Superb Product!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this grate! Very heavy duty, nice clearance underneath, and it keeps everything together on top with the flanged edges!! Superb product and should last a long time. Will hold a lot of wood, even larger logs. Arrived well packaged for such a heavy product. If I could give it ten stars, I would!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: G800 Series Cast Iron Grate
customer_reviews.text: This was the perfect fit for my fireplace and my husband is very happy with it. He heats the house with the fireplace at least 3-4 times a week and when the temp drops he uses it every night. Time will tell if it holds up but it's looking good as of now. He also picked this one with the higher legs so he doesnt' have to clean the ash as often.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Super product.
customer_reviews.text: Great buy, looks so nice with the fire burning. It also prevents half burnt logs from falling through the grate.
customer_reviews.author: mars

customer_reviews.title: Don't Bother!
customer_reviews.text: Nice and heavy but don't even bother! I tried to order this twice (always the optimist) but each time it arrives it's broken. Not worth the effort.
customer_reviews.author: C. Thurston

customer_reviews.title: DOA
customer_reviews.text: Nothing special about this grate. Mine arrived broken. What a hassle sending this heavy thing back.
customer_reviews.author: DWM

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: GRATE THAT WAS PURCHASED HAD ONE OF ITS LEGS AN INCH SHORTER THAN THE OTHER THREE--WILL NOT SIT LEVEL.
customer_reviews.author: terry t turlington

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good heavy duty. Hope it last longer than the one that came with the house.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for the $$
customer_reviews.text: Great for the $$! (Pun intended) we had been using way too small a grate in our fireplace for years. This allows us to really have a big beautiful fire
customer_reviews.author: Andrea D. Tasi

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my son and he loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Angels

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: solid, heavy, big, should hold 18 inch or even bigger logs securely
customer_reviews.author: mark  Kahn

customer_reviews.title: Looks better in person.
customer_reviews.text: This looks better in person. Very durable and looks amazing. This product shipped and arrived on time in perfect condition.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Great grate
customer_reviews.text: Large, stable base for building a fire. Easy enough to clean out. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Pescatello

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great grate. Legs weren't as long as I needed to go over log lighter
customer_reviews.author: skrayeski

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This was an awesome purchase. Very heavy duty. Even for a very hot fire.
customer_reviews.author: JERRY KLEINPETER

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and we'll-made. Haven't burned wood on it yet but expect it'll be fine.
customer_reviews.author: jane

customer_reviews.title: too soon to tell
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Allow more heat with the raised legs. Too early to see how long will last though.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: ... SHORT WHILE BUT I MEETS MY NEEDS AND SEEMS LIKE IT WILL LAST FOR A LONG TIME
customer_reviews.text: JUST BEEN USING IT A SHORT WHILE BUT I MEETS MY NEEDS AND SEEMS LIKE IT WILL LAST FOR A LONG TIME.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen Harp

customer_reviews.title: Cast iron grate
customer_reviews.text: Great item. Sturdy and fits perfectly. Keeps small logs and embers on the grate rather than falling through. Side rails help keep logs in grate.
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy

customer_reviews.title: Just ehhhh...
customer_reviews.text: This is an ok item but really no different than any other grate I've purchased in my life.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Untra Heavy-Duty Fireplace Grate.
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and heavy grate. Was too big and heavy for my fireplace. This is an ultra heavy-duty grate. You will only need for a substantial, larger fireplace. I think it should last many years.
customer_reviews.author: PK1950

customer_reviews.title: are already see will need to replace as not happy with the depth
customer_reviews.text: had it for a few fires.. should of asked what the depth was as only 12 inches deep so add in the sides and about 10 inches deep really needs to be deeper for bigger logs.. two logs of any size barely fit... my last few 27 inch grates were 15 and 16 inches deep.. would shop around next time and not get this grate.. are already see will need to replace as not happy with the depth.. my own fault for not finding that out.
customer_reviews.author: Brian F Chartier

customer_reviews.title: Looking Forward To Sitting By The Fire
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used it yet but based on other reviews, it should work fine.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lowe

product_meta.title: HY-C Liberty Foundry G800-20-BX Fire Grate, 20" W x 15" D x 7" H, Black
product_meta.description: Size:20" W x 15" D x 7" HLiberty Foundry grates are constructed of heavy-duty cast iron which stands up to the hottest of fires. By comparison, imitation cast iron grates minimize the weight of the iron where it’s needed most delivering a counterfeit-casting that buckles under heat. Our grates are designed with long-term durability in mind equipping you with long-term performance. You’ll feel the difference of a Liberty Foundry grate right out of the box! Cast as a one piece, heavy-duty, flat bottom basket-style fireplace grate, our G800-20-BX model measures 20” (front) x 16” (back) x 15” (depth) with a 4” cast-on leg clearance. Durably built, each grate weighs approximately 23 lbs. (Actual forged grate dimensions and weight may vary slightly. )
feature_bullets: Measures 20” (front) x 16” (back) x 15” (depth) with a 4” cast-on leg clearance
Crafted with heavy-duty cast iron, Designed with long-term durability in mind equipping you with long-term performance - feel the difference of a Liberty Foundry grate right out of the box
Provides maximum airflow under the fire to encourage efficient burning while conquering frustrations caused by poorly drafting chimneys
Lifts wood off the firebox floor and securely holds it above ash build-up, allowing air to circulate freely and fan your flame
Designed with optimized depths enabling easy wood loading while safely containing the hottest of fires

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars113 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
